page.title: 06PICNIC SITE / N.T. RESERVE
page.content: This picnic site doubles up as a N.T. nature reserve. The reserve was opened on the 30th July 1983. The site was formally a rubbish tip for Ramsgate. Unfortunately the reserve does not have a guided tour, but there are plenty of well marked footpaths. {Number of visitors:} Year 1985/85 was 60,000. Cars can park for a small fee. {Wildlife: Spring-Summer:}Shelduck, Common Tern, Swallow, Reed Bunting, Redshanks, Avocets. {Autumn-Winter: Wigeon, Stonechat, Oystercatchers and the Black-Headed Gull. 30% of the trees have been planted by pupils from secondary schools. Many species of flora in the primary stage of growth can be seen. There is a part time warden to look after the picnic site and nature reserves which overlooks the saltings of Pegwell Bay and the Stour Estuary
